reviews.review_msg: New to teaching. Not organized. Very young and quite in to her research. Changed the outline too much. Assignment expectations were not clear and led her to be an unfair marker. Not sure what she wanted from us. Course was okay.

She is disorganized and spends an EXCESSIVE amount of time discussing her own research. She  attempts to discuss material she is not prepared to explain. Assignment expectations were unclear. The student presentations were the only fun part. I would not recommend this instructor until she develops her teaching skills.

The most unorganized prof ever, however her assignments are easy and surprisingly enjoyable. Her lectures usually always comprise of her talking about her work in the down town east side. Barley go over readings and she rarley follows the syllabus she gives out. Great person and easy marker, but seems to busy with her discertation to teach properly

Nice person, theory driven, did give a lot of examples. Funny. making the online course really a community of support. SHe treats students as peers, and give you a lot of space for personal voices. like her.
Passionate prof, flexible and easy going, she can sometimes funny. I like the marking scheme. she treats students almost as peers and allows you to talk and present a lot. Will take her again.

Jie is really smart and very informative however she is a terrible professor. In 201, we were required to facilitate a 2 HOUR presentation in pairs and the mark for this presentation was lumped into our participation grade worth a total of only 15%. Her tests are extremely obscure and very long. I would never willingly take another class with her
I really like her teaching styles, open and flexibile. Tests are all open book no need to memorize anything, but you have to come to class to really understand those concepts. fair marker

Jie treats you as an equal instead of as a student, as long as you pay attention. Assignments were easy and open-ended, however it's VERY important that you clarify what she's looking for. SA201 is all about discussions, so you'd better be familiar with the big topics in humanities (like Neoliberalism) because she didn't explain them in depth.

Jie is nice and is interested in what she teaches, but NEVER again will I take a class with her.  She makes you feel stupid when you ask her a question.  Not only does she give you a look(which makes me feel stupid), but she also doesn't know how to explain her answers.  She expects you to get her right away.  She rarely respond to your email
I really like Jie. She is such a pleasant, enthusiastic person. I like all her China examples and her fieldwork stories which make this theory course very interesting. she is a fair marker too.
Love her class. Theory driven but her teaching made me think.

Jie is great teacher. very enthusiastic about theories and good at teaching theories. And also she has a great personality, very pleasant and optimistic. She could easily come up with some moving anecdotes to cheer you up. But some of her theories are very updated and may take a while to understand, but she reviewed alot.

Would not recommend her as a professor. She knows her stuff but can't teach it. She took things personally, and was on a short fuse most of the time. I think she may become a better prof in the future but she hasn't been teaching long enough. Take her classes only if you are very patient and don't expect to learn much!
